ef708adb-e776-42be-aa5c-50592475c099.description: Earners of this certificate have deepened their understanding & application of DEI, understand blatant versus subtle bias in the workplace, how to take action & be color brave, how to pursue racial equity, how to build an inclusive organization through intersectionality, & how to engage in cultural appreciation rather than appropriation. Through weekly conversations on these topics guided by a master DEI facilitator, the earner can now effectively apply these concepts in real-time.
ef708adb-e776-42be-aa5c-50592475c099.name: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Executive - Advanced Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Center for Executive Excellence

alignments.name: Human Resources Certification Institute
alignments.description: This Program has been approved for 36 HR (General) recertification credit hours toward aPHR™, aPHRi™, PHR®, PHRca®, SPHR®, GPHR®, PHRi™ and SPHRi™recertification through HR Certification Institute® (HRCI®). The 36 credits are issued to those who complete all four levels of the Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Executive program.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must complete all six (6) microlearning modules, including interactive knowledge checks, quizzes and actionable takeaways: (1) Housing: The Long Through Line of Racism (2) Not So Subtle Bias in the Workplace (3) Learning to Be Color Brave (4) Achieving Racial Equity (5) Building An Inclusive Workplace: A Look at Intersectionality (6) Cultural Appreciation, Not Appropriation
Attend 24 (90-minute) weekly group conversations guided by master DEI facilitators on subject matter covered by each module.
Complete weekly homework assignments and handouts

f49f7c29-e0dc-463d-b810-e645514ecbc4.description: Earners of this certificate have learned fundamental concepts in the DEI space such as how to raise organizational awareness, build their personal and corporate diversity IQ, recognize and combat unconscious bias, build bias interrupter skills in the recruitment process and everyday office interactions, and how to start opening the dialogue at work. Through weekly conversations on these topics guided by a master DEI facilitator, the earner can now effectively apply these concepts in real time.
f49f7c29-e0dc-463d-b810-e645514ecbc4.name: Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Executive - Foundations Certificate

The 36 credits are issued to those who complete all four levels of the Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Executive program.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge must complete all six (6) microlearning modules, including interactive knowledge checks, quizzes and actionable takeaways: (1) Boosting Your Diversity Intelligence (2) The Truth About Unconscious Bias (3) Focusing in on Our Assumptions (4) Are We All Biased? (5) Becoming a Bias Interrupter (6) Opening the Dialogue
Attend 24 (90-minute) weekly group conversations guided by master DEI facilitators on subject matter covered by each module.
Complete weekly homework assignments and handouts

bce62369-5b48-4847-a548-96a7cf88416a.description: Earners of this certificate have explored the different dimensions of DEI such as how to understand & help people with autism succeed, leveraging the gifts of diverse ages, navigating the disability language landscape, putting inclusive language to work, understanding the do’s & don’ts of workplace religion practices, & how to use inclusive language. Through weekly conversations on these topics guided by a master DEI facilitator, the earner can now effectively apply these concepts in real-time.

Through weekly conversations on these topics guided by a master DEI facilitator, the earner can now effectively apply these concepts in real time.
